Tooltip_PetConsole: A special console for managing and naming tamed creatures.
Tooltip_PetConsoleFragment: A damaged creature management console. This would have been used by Alterra scientists to tag their cloning experiments, as well as to terminate aggressive test subjects.
Tooltip_PetFabricator: A special fabricator for replicating creatures from fragments of DNA. This would have been used by Alterra scientists to clone and tame local creatures.
Tooltip_PetFabricatorFragment: A damaged piece of a creature clone fabricator. This would have been used by Alterra scientists to manipulate the genome of native creatures in the hope of controlling and weaponizing the beast.
EncyDesc_PetDna: With the destruction of the Aurora, experiments planned by the Alterra Corporation to pacify and weaponise the local fauna never progressed. These abandoned DNA sample containers appear to have come into contact with genetic material from various animals, triggering the collection process. With the right equipment, it might be possible to combine these samples with base materials to clone domestic variants of native creatures. Ideal for companionship in a lonely base.
EncyDesc_PetFabricator: A variant of the fabricators used day to day by billions, this piece of equipment was customised to fabricate cloned copies of various creatures using samples of their DNA. The device is programmed to manipulate the genome of the subject, pacifying the animal and giving human handlers control of the beasts behaviour. With a corresponding control console, this machine could be repurposed to create passive clones of some of the native creatures of planet 4546B, given the right genetic material to process.
EncyDesc_PetConsole: This console was designed to allow Alterra scientists to tag and label their cloning experiments as part of a secret project to tame and weaponise creatures on planet 4546B. With the untimely destruction of the Aurora, these experiments never progressed. The machine also provided fail safes to neutralise cloned creatures that may have shown signs of aggression. Paired with the right fabricator, and with some DNA samples and base materials, it might still work.
Alert_NaughtyBoy: Sorry, pirates are not permitted to own a pet!
Alert_SpawnError: You can't spawn a pet here!
Alert_PlayerMustBeInBase: Player must be in a base to spawn a pet
Alert_ObjectBlocking: There is something blocking the spawn location:
Options_SkipCheck: Skip the check for obstacles when spawning pets.
Tooltip_CaveCrawlerPet: A pet Cave Crawler. Not suitable for arachnophobes!
Tooltip_CaveCrawlerPetDna: A sample of DNA from a Cave Crawler. These creatures are completely harmless. Apparently.
Tooltip_CatPet: A pet cat - how cute! I wonder who she belonged to?
Tooltip_CatPetDna: A sample of DNA from someone's pet cat. I wonder how that got here?
Tooltip_BloodCrawlerPet: A pet Blood Crawler. These creatures are nasty!
Tooltip_BloodCrawlerPetDna: A sample of DNA from a Blood Crawler. Hopefully these creatures aren't venomous!
Tooltip_CrabSquidPet: A pet Crab Squid. Look out for that EMP blast!
Tooltip_CrabSquidPetDna: A sample of DNA from a Crab Squid
Tooltip_AlienRobotPet: A pet Alien Robot. Can it really walk on walls?
Tooltip_AlienRobotPetDna: A sample of DNA from an Alien Robot. It would appear that these creatures have at least some genetic component. Technically, they are alive.
Tooltip_SnowstalkerBabyPet: A pet baby Snow Stalker. Careful, they bite!
Tooltip_SnowstalkerBabyPetDna: A sample of DNA from a baby Snow Stalker. Hopefully this is from one that doesn't bite!
Tooltip_PengwingAdultPet: A pet adult Pengwing. Something smells fishy!
Tooltip_PengwingAdultPetDna: A sample of DNA from an adult Pengling. With luck, this is from one that doesn't smell too fishy!
Tooltip_PenglingBabyPet: A pet baby Pengling. Very fuzzy and cute!
Tooltip_PenglingBabyPetDna: A sample of DNA from an baby Pengling. Likely from a very fluffy, fuzzy cute one.
Tooltip_PinnacaridPet: A pet Pinnacarid. These are beautiful creatures!
Tooltip_PinnacaridPetDna: A sample of DNA from a Pinnacarid. These would make great pets!
Tooltip_TrivalveYellowPet: A pet yellow Trivalve. Very rare and very beautiful.
Tooltip_TrivalveYellowPetDna: A sample of DNA from a yellow Trivalve. Quite rare, and very beautiful animals.
Tooltip_TrivalveBluePet: A pet blue Trivalve. A gorgeous creature, and friendly too.
Tooltip_TrivalveBluePetDna: A sample of DNA from a blue Trivalve. Not quite as unique as their golden cousins, but a stunning creature nonetheless.
